global_notes: Single baseline group G1. Surface matches results exactly. Two baseline outcomes: taxes_paid (binary compliance) and taxes_paid_amt (revenue amount). Many specs are cross-products of a single robustness dimension with both outcomes, which is appropriate. run_009 (rc/fe/sets/stratum_month_house) and run_010 (revenues variant) are exact duplicates of baselines run_001 and run_002 since stratum_month_house IS the baseline FE set. run_050 (rc/fe/sets/stratum_only__revenues__diff_means) equals run_004 (diff_in_means__revenues) since stratum-only FE with diff-in-means on revenues produces identical results.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: ITT: Effect of local (chief-led) vs central (state-led) property tax collection on tax compliance probability and revenue amount. RCT at neighborhood level in Kananga, DRC. Stratum + house type + time FE, clustered at polygon (a7).
baseline_groups.notes: run_001: taxes_paid ~ t_l | stratum+house+time FE, cluster(a7). coef=0.034, p<0.001, N=27643. run_002: taxes_paid_amt. coef=72.11, p<0.001, N=27643. Local collection increases compliance by 3.4 pp and revenues by ~72 FC.
